      static JsFunction create(NoArgsFunctionJsReturn<?> func)
      Important! The created function, when invoked by JavaScript, returns a JsReturnValue, which is an object that wraps the actual return value, accessed by the property name "value".

      • create

        public static JsFunction create(NoArgsFunctionReturn<?> func)
        Important! The created function, when invoked by JavaScript, returns a ReturnValue, which is an object that wraps the actual return value, accessed by the property name "value". So to get the value, you must do something like the following: funcPointer().value

        Important! The created function, when invoked by JavaScript, returns a JsReturnValue, which is an object that wraps the actual return value, accessed by the property name "value". So to get the value, you must do something like the following: funcPointer().value

      • create

        public static JsFunction create(VarArgsFunction func)
        Parameters:
        func - The instance function to call from JSNI, which may be called with multiple arguments. When invoked, JsFunction packages the arguments into a JavaScript array.
        Returns:

      • create

        public static JsFunction create(VarArgsFunctionReturn<?> func)
        Important! The created function, when invoked by JavaScript, returns a ReturnValue, which is an object that wraps the actual return value, accessed by the property name "value". So to get the value, you must do something like the following: funcPointer(args,...).value
        Parameters:
        func - The instance function to call from JSNI, which may be called with multiple arguments and should return a ReturnValue. When invoked, JsFunction packages the arguments into a JavaScript array.
        Returns:
        a GWT reference to an actual JavaScript function pointer

        Important! The created function, when invoked by JavaScript, returns a JsReturnValue, which is an object that wraps the actual return value, accessed by the property name "value". So to get the value, you must do something like the following: funcPointer(args,...).value

      • create

        public static JsResultOrError create(JsReturn<?> deferredFunctionResult)
        Parameters:
        deferredFunctionResult - The instance deferredFunctionResult to call from JSNI, taking a single result object, when invoked. Use JsReturnVoid to be informed of function completion, or to catch any Exception. Typical methods that take a JsReturn argument have accompanying versions that take no JsResult parameter for void methods that don't return a value. These are "fire and forget" methods that are expected to succeed, but if they don't, use the version that takes a JsReturn with JsReturn to catch exceptions.
        Returns:
        a GWT reference to an actual JavaScript function pointer
